channel.title: Magic

item.title: Magic
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

They set the gfx, the emote, the experience, max damage, runes used.

spell = 1152	711	90	1	1	558	1	556	1	-1	0	-1	0	-1	2	95	43	100	Wind_Strike

ID, emote, gfx, usesFirst, required lvl, rune1, rune1 ammount, rune2, rune2ammount, rune3, rune3ammount, rune4, rune4ammount, item, hitdiff (max hit), XP, projectile Height, End Height, Spell Name

Not exactly sure what usesFirst means, or item, but they are all the same value in all of the configs.

Read full topic

item.title: Magic
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

It’s the id of the spell. For example 1152 is Wind Strike. 1154 is Water Strike. 1156 is Earth Strike. It is all in the configuration files. Sorry forgot to mention, I’m using delta.

Read full topic

item.title: Magic
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Sorry for spamming this board with questions. :o I can’t seem to figure out what the problem is between these two cases. The first one is the Wind Strike, the next is Water Strike. Wind Strike works and Water Strike doesn’t. Only thing I can think of is that the actionbutton id’s are wrong. This is the same for every spell. Besides Wind Strike. And 1152 only pops up in ActionButtons class.

[code]case 7038:
c.autocastID = 1152;
c.sendFrame246(329, 200, c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]);
c.setSidebarInterface(0, 328);
break;

	case 7039:
		c.autocastID = 1154;
		c.sendFrame246(329, 200, c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]);
		c.setSidebarInterface(0, 328);
		break;[/code]

Thanks for all of your help. Probably something stupid I forgot/overlooked again. Like usual. ;D Always make the simple shit complicated.

Read full topic
